page.title: 17Historic Buildings
page.content: {St. Nicholas}church in Kemerton is one of the biggest churches.The tower is early English but the remainder was built in Victorian times.The{Ebenezer {Methodist}chapel at Aston Cross, the smallest church in our area,{Kinsham {Baptist}chapel and the Old{Methodist chapel in Bredon which is now closed were all built in the 1700 or1800s. The{Bredon Barn}was built in the 13th century by the Bishop of Worcester, who was the lord of Bredon Manor.It is one of the largest barns in England.In 1981-'82 there was a massive fire at the Barn,which destroyed the roof,now rebuilt.It is famous for its timbers.The{Rectory, once the Bishop's summer palace,was a very long building,but the middle was removed in 1953,and is now 2 separate houses. The oldest part is 13th century,but most is 17th or later.
